body:
hope it gets a translation soon,
cant understand a single thing
@Moroboshi Yuumei you're doing God's work my dude/dudette what or ever you are lol. You're the G.O.A.T.
If you are reading this comment your parents will die within 5 years. To undo this curse you need to copy this and paste it on 5 other manga. i am not sorry .
Nothing like some good lovey dovey sex to heal a broken soul

The short version: Guy meets a girl while on his way home, who begs him to let her stay at his house. Since he's drunk, he says he'll let her if she'll do it with him. Before anything happens, he passes out. Things happen and he lets her stay, with the main things being that she for some reason is good at doing chores and "servicing" people. Turns out she lives with her father, who raped her, uses her in that way and beats/abuses her. She starts off being skittish and is desperate to not go home. Protag does stuff to ease her into a normal life, but later decides to confront the girl's father. Conversation at the end is about the girl's name, since her name is Yuki, but the kanji used for it is the kanji for "happiness". She hated her name because she never experienced happiness, but is now has thanks to the protag. What they're submitting is the documentation to get a marriage license.
I don't care if I'm gonna die but I NEED DA TRANSLATION NOW

It's  this true if i ask for translation I'll die

I'm new to this comment is

It's not my cup of tea because of Yuki's overt "youngness" (protag's not sure if she's a JK or younger; doesn't help that she doesn't know what a condom is), but if you think of it as a story about a girl with an extremely shitty life getting rescued out of said life, it makes that pill a little easier to swallow. I will commend the artist for making her so skittish, nervous and desperate early on, since it helps make her development more evident as the story progresses.
That's what we call a great ending
